snippet: For this year’s Super Bowl in Indianapolis, the N.F.L. sold 7,300 media day tickets online for $25.
abstract: NFL opens its Super Bowl media day event to the public for the first time, selling 7,300 tickets online for $25; fans who entered were given an earpiece at the door that permitted them to listen to some of the interviews being conducted on the field as they sat in assigned lower-grandstand seats for three hours and merrily watched, cheered and laughed.
lead_paragraph: For this year’s Super Bowl in Indianapolis, the N.F.L. sold 7,300 media day tickets online for $25.

headline.seo: N.F.L. Opens Up Media Day, and It’s Win-Win
headline.main: N.F.L. Opens Up Media Day ($25), and It’s Win-Win
headline.print_headline: All About The Fans: N.F.L. Opens Up Media Day ($25), And It’s Win-Win
